implemented: Schema::string() creates a string schema (src/schema/mod.rs:67-69)
.min_len(5) rejects strings shorter than 5 characters (tested in tests/string_test.rs:27-40)
.max_len(10) rejects strings longer than 10 characters (tested in tests/string_test.rs:43-55)
Combining .min_len(5).max_len(10) validates both constraints (tested in tests/string_test.rs:58-75)
Both length violations reported if applicable (tested in tests/string_test.rs:78-88)
.pattern(r"^\d+$") validates string matches regex (tested in tests/string_test.rs:91-103)
Pattern failure includes the pattern in error message (tested in tests/string_test.rs:106-114)
.error("custom message") overrides default error message (tested in tests/string_test.rs:117-129)
Non-string values produce type error with code invalid_type (tested in tests/string_test.rs:132-160)
Length errors use code min_length and max_length (src/schema/string.rs:257, 273)
Pattern errors use code pattern (src/schema/string.rs:291)
All constraint errors accumulate in a single validation call (tested in tests/string_test.rs:163-175)
Validated strings are returned on success (tested in tests/string_test.rs:178-184)
Created src/schema/mod.rs as schema module root
Created src/schema/string.rs for string schema implementation
Created tests/string_test.rs for integration tests
Added regex and serde_json dependencies to Cargo.toml
Regex compilation happens at schema construction time (src/schema/string.rs:139-147)
Unicode-aware length counting using chars() (src/schema/string.rs:250, 266)
Clear separation between schema definition and validation execution
Comprehensive rustdoc documentation with examples for all public APIs
All 96 tests pass including 13 doc-tests
